feed.title: Your awesome title
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Creating the Second Version
entry.content:
Second Version

  • starting near from scratch
  • improvement
    • change in how storing planets
      • 2-d array of doubles
      • explain why chose to do this
  • issues
    • planets going offscreen
      • different solution (dragging field of view)
      • still did looping
    • planet collisions
      • talk about this in the next post
entry.summary: Second Version starting near from scratch improvement change in how storing planets 2-d array of doubles explain why chose to do this issues planets going offscreen different solution (dragging field of view) still did looping planet collisions talk about this in the next post

entry.title: Adding Collisions
entry.content:
in this post:

  • Why I chose to add collisions
  • implementing radius
    • simple, except for question of: “should the radius of a planet be random, or should it be based off of the planet’s mass, for example utilizing density”
  • initial solution
    • collision-like force that amplifies/appears when the planets would be colliding
  • the choice between types of collisions (elastic/non-elastic)
  • calculating the collisions
    • kinetic energy
    • conservation of momentum
entry.summary: in this post: Why I chose to add collisions implementing radius simple, except for question of: “should the radius of a planet be random, or should it be based off of the planet’s mass, for example utilizing density” initial solution collision-like force that amplifies/appears when the planets would be colliding the choice between types of collisions (elastic/non-elastic) calculating the collisions kinetic energy conservation of momentum

entry.title: First Version
entry.content:
Inspiration

First version:

  • looping
  • perspective
  • center of mass
  • planets as points
  • physics
  • different speeds of the simulation
  • manually inputting planet data
  • storing planets as class, array of planets to store them
  • packages using
    • using java swing/awt
  • method of remembering where planets were in the past
    • animate loop, call paintComponent rather than repaint in order to not paint backround/erase what was previously displayed
  • issues
    • planet collisions
    • planets going offscreen
      • solution - looping
        • consequences of having looping
    • want to have a record of the planet’s past movements
      • search for possible solutions

Hello, here is some code in Java:

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

Jekyll requires blog post files to be named according to the following format:

YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.MARKUP

Where YEAR is a four-digit number, MONTH and DAY are both two-digit numbers, and MARKUP is the file extension representing the format used in the file. After that, include the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.
